column2: Where can I find the check-in area?
column3: The check-in area is on the departure level, just after the main entrance. You’ll see counters for all airlines with digital signs showing flight numbers.

column2: How do I reach the departure terminal from the parking area?
column3: From the parking area, follow the signs marked 'Departures'. There are elevators and ramps available if you’re carrying luggage or traveling with family.

column2: Where is the baggage wrapping service?
column3: The baggage wrapping service is available right beside the check-in counters. It helps protect your bags during the flight.

column2: Is there a help desk inside the departure hall?
column3: Yes, there’s an information desk near the main entrance of the departure hall. They can assist you with flight schedules, gates, and directions.

column2: Where can I find trolleys for luggage?
column3: You can find luggage trolleys near every entrance and around the check-in counters. They’re free to use for all passengers.

column2: How can I reach Gate 8 quickly?
column3: Once you pass through the security check, follow the yellow signs for Gates 5 to 10. Gate 8 will be on your left side near the coffee shop.

column2: Where can I find a restroom near the gates?
column3: Restrooms are available near every two gates. You’ll find clean facilities right after Gate 4 and Gate 9.

column2: Is there a cafeteria in the departure area?
column3: Yes, there are several cafes and restaurants in the departure lounge. Gloria Jeans and Cinnabon are popular choices for a quick snack or coffee.

column2: Where can I charge my phone?
column3: Charging stations are available in all seating areas of the departure lounge. You’ll also find USB ports next to some seats.

column2: Is Wi-Fi available in the departure hall?
column3: Yes, free Wi-Fi is available for all passengers. Just connect to 'IIAP-Free-WiFi' and follow the on-screen instructions.

column2: Where can I find prayer rooms?
column3: Prayer rooms are located near Gates 3 and 7. Both male and female prayer areas are clearly marked and easily accessible.

column2: How do I know when boarding starts?
column3: Boarding announcements are made through speakers and shown on the flight information screens. Make sure you’re near your gate 45 minutes before departure.

column2: Is there a lounge for business class passengers?
column3: Yes, the CIP and business class lounges are available near Gate 5. They offer snacks, Wi-Fi, and comfortable seating.

column2: Can I carry liquids in my handbag?
column3: You can carry small liquid containers under 100ml each in a transparent plastic bag. Larger bottles must go in checked luggage.

column2: Where can I find the immigration counters?
column3: Immigration counters are right after the security check for international passengers. Keep your passport and ticket ready for inspection.

column2: Is there a smoking area inside the terminal?
column3: Yes, there’s a designated smoking area near Gate 9. Please follow the signs marked 'Smoking Lounge'.

column2: Where can I buy a SIM card or mobile top-up?
column3: There’s a mobile shop next to the main food court in the departure hall where you can buy SIM cards, top-ups, and accessories.

column2: How do I get wheelchair assistance?
column3: You can request wheelchair assistance at your airline’s check-in counter. A staff member will accompany you through security and boarding.

column2: Where can I find the lost and found counter?
column3: The lost and found counter is located beside the main information desk in the departure area. You can report or collect lost items there.

column2: Can I bring my baby stroller to the gate?
column3: Yes, you can take your stroller up to the gate. Airline staff will tag it and return it when you land at your destination.

column2: Is there a baby changing room available?
column3: Yes, baby changing rooms are located near the washrooms by Gates 2 and 8. They’re equipped with changing tables and sanitizer.

column2: Where can I pay for excess baggage?
column3: You can pay excess baggage fees at your airline’s service counter located beside the check-in area. Keep your receipt for verification.

column2: Is there a medical help desk at the airport?
column3: Yes, there’s a medical help desk near Gate 4, equipped with first aid and emergency support staff.

column2: Where can I find currency exchange services?
column3: Currency exchange counters are available near Gates 5 and 11. You can convert PKR to foreign currency before departure.

column2: Can I find duty-free shops before boarding?
column3: Yes, duty-free shops are available in the international departure lounge. You can buy perfumes, chocolates, and souvenirs before your flight.

column2: Where is the security check area?
column3: The security check area is right after the check-in counters. Please keep your boarding pass and ID ready for scanning.

column2: How do I get updates about my flight gate change?
column3: Gate change announcements are made on the loudspeakers and displayed on the digital boards. Keep an eye on your flight number.

column2: Where can I find airline staff for help?
column3: You can find airline staff near your airline’s check-in counters and around the boarding gates. They’re always available for assistance.

column2: Is there a waiting area for families?
column3: Yes, there’s a family waiting area near Gate 6 with seating, restrooms, and snack options nearby.

column2: How do I reach the upper departure lounge?
column3: You can take the escalator or elevator from the main hall to reach the upper departure lounge. It’s well-signposted inside the terminal.

column2: Can I find a place to print my ticket?
column3: Yes, there’s a printing and photocopy service beside the information desk on the departure level.

column2: Where can I get information about connecting flights?
column3: You can get details about connecting flights at the transfer information desk near Gate 10 or by asking your airline staff.

column2: Where are the airline offices inside the terminal?
column3: Most airline offices are located behind the check-in counters. You can visit them for ticketing or customer service.

column2: Can I carry my pet with me on the flight?
column3: Most airlines allow pets in the cabin or cargo area. Check with your airline at least 24 hours before your flight for pet policy details.

column2: Where can I find drinking water?
column3: There are water dispensers located beside every washroom and near the boarding gates. You can refill your bottles there.

column2: Is there an ATM inside the departure terminal?
column3: Yes, there are ATMs from several banks located near Gates 2 and 7 in the departure hall.

column2: Where can I find announcements for boarding?
column3: All boarding and delay announcements are made through the terminal speakers and displayed on the large flight screens near the gates.

column2: How do I get from domestic to international gates?
column3: After security, follow the blue signs that say ‘International Departures’. Domestic gates are to the left and international to the right.

column2: Is there any shop to buy travel accessories?
column3: Yes, you’ll find a travel essentials shop near Gate 3 selling neck pillows, eye masks, and chargers.

column2: Can I find a pharmacy inside the terminal?
column3: Yes, there’s a pharmacy near Gate 5 where you can buy medicines, pain relievers, or travel-size health products.

column2: Is there a place to sit near Gate 11?
column3: Yes, there’s a large seating area near Gate 11 with charging points and snack counters close by.

column2: Can I get food after security check?
column3: Yes, several cafes and snack bars are available after security. You can grab a meal while waiting for your flight.

column2: Where can I find elevators or lifts?
column3: Elevators are available near every gate section and beside the main escalators for easy access with luggage.

column2: Is there a taxi or ride service counter inside?
column3: Yes, ride service counters like Careem and InDriver are available near the exit of the departure hall for drop-off bookings.

column2: Where can I find airport maps?
column3: Printed maps are available at the information desk, and digital maps are displayed on the large touchscreens near Gate 2.

column2: How do I find my way to the boarding gate?
column3: Follow the overhead signs that show gate numbers and directions. The path is clearly marked and easy to navigate.

column2: Is there a separate line for families at security?
column3: Yes, there’s a family-friendly lane at the security check to make the process easier for parents with kids.

column2: Can I get assistance for elderly travelers?
column3: Absolutely. You can request assistance at your airline counter, and a staff member will guide the passenger through all airport steps.

column2: Where can I relax before my flight?
column3: You can relax in the departure lounge seating area or enjoy coffee at any of the nearby cafes until boarding starts.

column2: Are there lockers to keep extra luggage?
column3: Yes, there are luggage lockers available near the main departure entrance. You can store small bags securely for a few hours.

column3: For departure, always carry your passport or national ID and boarding pass. If traveling internationally, ensure your visa is valid. Keep photocopies of important documents.
